thread.title: Limpopo is burning

author: news24.com
title: Limpopo is burning
text:
Department of Environmental Affairs’ Working on Fire (WoF) participants in Limpopo has been very busy battling raging fires across the province.
The past weekend has been the busiest for the WoF teams in the Waterberg after the heat wave was declared by South African Weather Services. A total of 260 fire fighters, 1 chopper and 2 fire trucks and 6 bakkies and bakkie sakkies were deployed to 20 multiple fires in different areas in the Waterberg District.
“Our fire fighters have been trained vigorously in fire suppression and we do believe that they will conquer all the wildfires that are occurring in the province” said Mr Sam Maepa the Provincial General Manager at Working on Fire Limpopo.
An Incident Command Structure has been established and based at Alma as is busy monitoring and managing the all the fires including the resources. Some of the caused by lighting while the cause of the other fires are still unknown.
 “The terrain where our participants are working on is not very easy as it is mountainous and this also causes the fire to burn very fast” mentioned Maepa.
The damage known so far includes an estimation of 70,000 hectares of land, 1 farmhouse, 3 houses, 3 vehicles, 2 lodges and a lot of animals both wild and domestic.
 WoF has requested for more resources from other Provinces due to the intensity of the fire and the number of fires that are occurring in the province more especially in the Waterberg District. The resources that arrived so far includes 4 ground teams with a fire trucks from Mpumalanga and 1 ground team from Gauteng.
 “We are working closely with various stakeholders who are affected and we are hoping for a positive outcome sooner than later” concluded Maepa
